metadata.title: Changes in Distribution of Drift Ice and Recruitment of Walleye Pollock in the Eastern Bering Sea (in Japanese).
metadata.description: Time series of anomalies of three month (Jan-Mar) averaged air temperature at St. Paul Island, averaged minimum temperature at the bottom layer in the fixed area, distance of 32.0 isohaline from the Alaskan coast, NW component of wind, and residence time (frequency) of drift ice on the southeastern shelf.
metadata.notes:
Purpose: To examine the influence of winter sea conditions on recruitment of walleye pollock.

Status: In Progress

Maintenance frequency: Annually

Access constraints: None

Use constraints: None
